Name: Acroosteolysis dominant type
Synonyms_List__c: Acroosteolysis with osteoporosis and changes in skull and mandible, Arthrodentoosteodysplasia, Cheney syndrome, Hajdu-Cheney syndrome, Serpentine fibula-polycystic kidneys syndrome
Disease_Description__c: Hajdu-Cheney syndrome is a rare autosomal dominant skeletal disorder characterized by short stature, coarse and dysmorphic facies, bowing of the long bones, and vertebral anomalies. Facial features include hypertelorism, bushy eyebrows, micrognathia, small mouth with dental anomalies, low-set ears, and short neck. There is progressive focal bone destruction, including acroosteolysis and generalized osteoporosis. Additional and variable features include hearing loss, renal cysts, and cardiovascular anomalies (summary by Ramos et al., 1998; Simpson et al., 2011; Isidor et al., 2011).
